verses.roman:
tato megha-kulāny aṅga
citra varṇāny anekaśaḥ
śataṁ varṣāṇi varṣanti
nadanti rabhasa-svanaiḥ

synonyms: tataḥ—then; megha-kulāni—the clouds; aṅga—my dear King; citra-varṇāni—of various colors; anekaśaḥ—numerous; śatam—one hundred; varṣāṇi—years; varṣanti—they pour down rain; nadanti—they thunder; rabhasa-svanaiḥ—with tremendous sounds.
translation: After that, O King, groups of multicolored clouds will gather, roaring terribly with thunder, and will pour down floods of rain for one hundred years.
